heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 04 January 2025 with a total accumulation of 36.8mm over 37.2 hours and falling at a rate of 4.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: Rain fell for 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025 creating a new record that still lasts.  The storm produced a total of 36.8mm with a maximum intensity of 4.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: There are no active storms in the area.  The previous storm started on 23 October 2025 and lasted 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 6 so far this year, while the average is 3.7.

extreme.status: The largest temperature gap recorded is 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C) on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: Currently, the weather is stable with no heatwaves in progress.  So far, 6 heatwavess have been recorded this year.  The average yearly count is 1.9.

tropical.status: The most recent tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and this has only occurred 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (180°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (231.0°) by approximately 51.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The largest wind run ever was on 21 October 2012 with a value of 1737 miles.

speed.status: The record wind speed remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, cooler for the outside temperature (down 3.4°C), feels like temperature (down 3.0°C), and inside temperature (down 1.6°C) and drier conditions in rainfall (down 0.3 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 4331 lux) and cloud levels (up 167 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 5610 lux) and cloud levels (up 526 m) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 167.0m lower than yesterday, 179.8m lower than the past week, 526.3m lower than the past month.

Yesterday, the cloud levels ranged from a minimum of 791m to a maximum of 1764m, averaging 878.9m; the past week and month had slightly higher averages of 1058.7m and 1405.2m respectively.
cloud levels.summary: Fog or low cloud is expected.

summary.summary: Inside; cool or mild temperatures. Outside; prepare for cold, chilly weather ahead. Also, dry air conditions likely prevail and calm and still conditions are expected. Possible light showers, fog or low cloud is expected, and it’s dim outside. Weather could become unsettled.

washing.phrase: The current temperature is too low (4.2°C) for optimal drying conditions.  Any drying will take longer.
